elements.title: About the job
elements.text: Do you want to join a fast-paced startup and work on the bleeding edge of recommendation systems, where your work immediately impacts the user experience for millions of users? We are looking for a Senior Fullstack / Backend Engineer who thrives in a fast-moving environment.

elements.title: What you will be building:
elements.text: Recommendation systems that are guaranteed to always show relevant recommendations for any scenario and that are easy to maintain, deploy and improve.

elements.title: We need someone who we can count on to:
content: ðŸ™‹ Own: Improve our recommendation systems for new and existing customers, improve tooling to deploy, introspect and monitor our recommendation systems to constantly make them better.

ðŸ’» Teach: What's possible and what's not possible? Tradeoffs between iteration speed and complexity of architecture. How to build a system that is easy to debug and that fails gracefully if there would be changes in the input data.
ðŸŽ’ Learn: Our approach to recommendation systems, data engineering best practices, machine learning basics.
ðŸš´ Improve: Robustness, performance, and observability of our system, to delight the end-users of our product.

elements.title: We expect you to:
content: Be proficient in Python (or able to quickly learn it)
Care about writing good code
Be comfortable with command line tools
Enjoy architecting and developing solutions to ambiguous problems.

elements.title: Desired skills and qualities
content: Deployed applications using cloud platforms or your own servers
Having worked in a mature data engineering codebases
Experience taking product decisions
Proficiency with cloud computing (AWS, GCP, or Azure)
Used Docker, Kubernetes, Argo or similar

elements.title: Within 1 month we expect you to:
content: Understand the ins and outs of how our current recommendation system, data pipelines, and recommendation API works
Have been in several customer calls understanding how they perceive our product
Get to know the team and learn from and collaborate on directing the product development forward
Configure, optimize and measure the performance for newly onboarded e-commerce stores

elements.title: Within 3 months we expect you to:
content: Significantly improve the quality of recommendations using more facets of data impacting the user experience on > 50% of our integrated customers
Generalize our system further, ensuring that recommendations for new customers are perfect from day zero with close to no fine-tuning necessary
Improve our codebase such as adding tests and monitoring of our recommendation's performance

elements.title: Within 6 months we expect you to:
content: Lead focused projects to improve our product further, e.g. relating to model performance, deeper personalization, knowing users across platforms, etc
Have ownership of one or multiple areas in a rapidly growing company
Ensure our codebase supports adding new features in a seamless way

elements.title: Within 12 months we expect you to:
content: Architect new product features and lead the implementation
Contribute to the vision and long-term strategy of our company and product
Start exploring ways to increase our product offering outside of just product recommendations

elements.title: About the job
elements.text: Do you want to join a fast-paced startup and work on the bleeding edge of recommendation systems, where your work immediately impacts the user experience for millions of users?

Weâ€™re lookingâ€‹ for a frontend developer to help to expand our efforts in providing world-class product recommendations to any e-commerce store. Youâ€™ll be working with internal state-of-the-art tech that can be used to deploy our service anywhere in 5-minutes.

elements.title: We need someone to:
content: ðŸ™‹ Own: Rapid deployments for new customers, using and building upon our micro-frontend deployments technology.
ðŸŽ’ Learn: Architect integrations resilient to minor style changes, optimize loading speeds, and how to hack into popular SPA-frameworks.
ðŸš´ Improve: Efficiency and robustness of integrations operating inside evolving environments.

elements.title: What you will be building
elements.text: Self-contained JavaScript scripts that add Depict.aiâ€™s AI-functionality to e-commerce websites.

elements.title: We expect you to know how to
content: Write robust Javascript for web browsers
Design and implement beautiful recommendation surfaces with HTML and CSS

elements.title: Nice to haves
content: Typescript
Experience using JSX
Experience with tracking and analytics
Deep knowledge of how to optimize browser performance
Having read the book Third-Party Javascript

elements.title: About the job
elements.text: Do you want to join a fast-paced startup and work on the bleeding edge of recommendation systems, where your work immediately impacts the user experience for millions of users? We are looking for tech lead who thrives in a fast-moving environment.

elements.title: What you will be doing:
elements.text: Your mission will be to lead and manage the Expansion Team working on implementing new clients of Depict. This is a super exciting role where no day looks the same.

elements.title: We need someone who we can count on to:
content: ðŸ™‹ Own: Streamline our delivery process. Head up and run our new expansion team â€“ shipping integrations to new customers and improve our processes to deploy, iterate and improve our recommendation systems to constantly make them better.

ðŸ’» Teach: What's possible and what's not possible? Tradeoffs between iteration speed and complexity of custom integrations and one-size-fits-all. How to build a system that is a one-click onboarding for new stores to use Depict.
ðŸŽ’ Learn: Our deployment workflows, data collection best practices, the art and science of third-party javascript as well as efficient architectures for Machine Learning in production.
ðŸš´ Improve: Developer Experience and productivity, time to go live for completely new e-commerce website, iteration speed and robustness of our entire system.

elements.title: Your profile:
content: You are a developer by heart and thrive in a super techie environment.
You see yourself as somewhat of a hustler and can take initiative to hustle a team through any challenge.
Previous experience in leading developers, informally or as team-lead.
Understanding of key aspects of good project management.
Can have a clear vision in the intersection of tech and business.

elements.title: We expect you to:
content: Keen on taking on leadership and responsibility.
Have previous experience in a startup-like environment.
Business-focused, keen on understanding what value we are bringing to the clients.

elements.title: Depict.ai - What we are doing
elements.text: In just a matter of months we, a small team of engineers in Stockholm, have been changing the playing field for recommendation systems in e-commerce â€“ a gigantic market where our competitors are among the largest tech companies to find. And this is just the beginning â€“ we see a path of immense growth ahead of us. As for the next steps, we are starting to look at our international expansion to get Depict.ai into larger markets outside of Sweden â€“ if you are up for a ride of a lifetime, this is your new home!

elements.title: About the job
elements.text: We are looking for a senior full stack developer that will also lead our team of developers. At Bemlo, you will do a bit of everything. Some days you will focus on strategy and recruiting. Other days you will dive into the codebase and deliver value to the customers.

elements.title: Responsibilities
content: Architecture: Improve the codebase and Bemlos already existing architecture.
Recruiting: Be responsible for sourcing, setting up processes and recruiting a team of stars.
Develop the team: Set up goals for each individual in the development team and help them improve.
Coding: Development in full-stack Typescript. Set up and deliver processes needed for an effective code organisation, everything from development board to pipelines.

elements.title: The skills you'll need
content: Excellent project management skills
Love closing new clients, and do everything that it takes to make both Volta and our partners succeed
A talent for communication, in writing and in person, in English and in Swedish
Thus, also being a maven with presentations (we use Google Slides / Keynote)
Be a team player, with strong self motivation, results-orientation and sense of purpose

elements.title: Qualifications
content: A general understanding of web development, everything from backend to frontend.
Have built multiple web applications with databases, backend and frontend.
Senior Full-stack Typescript developer.
Have experience of leading a team and interested in leadership.
Be able to resonate about the product and understand what is important for the users. And be able to come up with ideas on how the product can be improved.

elements.title: Extra credits if you
content: Have experience of working with FMCG
Have previously worked with OKRâ€™s or similar

elements.title: What you'll get
content: A chance to work on one of the worldâ€™s biggest, yet unresolved climate challenges
A chance to be surrounded daily by a team of industry experts, as well as brand-name clients and partners
A competitive salary package, with a stock option plan
A yearly stipend for health and tech expenses

elements.title: About the job
elements.text: You? A fearless, dedicated Business Developer, ready to take on CO2-emitters acting as if Greta had never gone on strike. Us? Weâ€™re a-just-over-two-year-old company backed by experienced investors with a mission to fight global warming by removing farts and burps from cows.  Over here, things are moving at a high pace. Getting closer to introducing our first climate-friendly products, we need to boost our team further. We are now looking for a Business Developer, supporting us with the critical launch of a potentially revolutionizing type of product in Sweden (and later, internationally). Specs below!

elements.title: Start date & location
elements.text: ASAP. The role is based out of our Stockholm HQ at Karolinska Institutet, with occasional trips to our production facility in Lysekil on the Swedish west coast.

elements.title: The work you'll take on includes
content: Defining and leading the launch of our new, environmentally groundbreaking product line in Swedish supermarkets
Nurturing and initiating relationships with both new and existing clients
Support in project financing, directing consultants as well as taking on writing yourself when necessary
When required (and have no doubt, it will be!) - jumping into additional projects and roles supporting additional parts of the company

elements.title: The skills you'll need
content: Excellent project management skills
Love closing new clients, and do everything that it takes to make both Volta and our partners succeed
A talent for communication, in writing and in person, in English and in Swedish
Thus, also being a maven with presentations (we use Google Slides / Keynote)
Be a team player, with strong self motivation, results-orientation and sense of purpose

elements.title: Your (presumed) background
content: Relevant education and work experience
Led and executed successful projects with many stakeholders
A minimum 3 years of work experience in a fast-paced environment
5+ years of experience, including leadership, from complex sales and project management, preferably from the food and/or agriculture industry

elements.title: Extra credits if you
content: Have experience of working with FMCG
Have previously worked with OKRâ€™s or similar

elements.title: What you'll get
content: A chance to work on one of the worldâ€™s biggest, yet unresolved climate challenges
A chance to be surrounded daily by a team of industry experts, as well as brand-name clients and partners
A competitive salary package, with a stock option plan
A yearly stipend for health and tech expenses

elements.title: About the job
elements.text: As Head of Manufacturing you will lead our manufacturing efforts. That means that you will build up large-scale factories to enable the production of Volta Seafeed that will transform the food industry. We are a tightly knit team, and youâ€™ll work together with our founders, business team and R&D team in developing all manufacturing aspects.

elements.title: Responsibilities
elements.text: Volta is a new company, in a fast-changing environment. The company will evolve, and your role, responsibilities and deliverables will change with it.

content: Lead the manufacturing strategy and execute tactical plans to scale up production of our macroalgae based feed supplement by working closely with R&D and Engineering team.
Develop strategic partnership with key production partners and suppliers
Lead / assist in recruitment of key team members
Supply chain management
Project management of site selection and site construction from idea to start up to assure early choices and decisions are made to maximize speed and scale up.
Work closely with R&D and Engineering team on development of Volta Greentechâ€™s production blueprint to ensure excellent production results optimized for low-cost, high output production.
Financial cost breakdown and budgeting

elements.title: Key skills
content: Degree in Engineering
Purpose driven
Experience of working in a startup
Experience of leading teams to take manufacturing from lab scale to large scale production
Experience with developing and commercializing technologies within food, beverages, biotechnology, life sciences or synthetic biology sector.
A working knowledge of a wide range of food and bio manufacturing processes
Strong project management skills and ability to lead large manufacturing expansion projects

A deep expertise in operations and quality management leveraging LEAN, six-sigma and/or other leading metrics-driven methodologies; Known for establishing an operating system and cadence based on KPIs.
Problem solving: you thrive in change, learn fast and view challenges as growth opportunities
Excellent execution: you get things done, fast and with high quality
Team player: you believe a good company starts from within, and act accordingly
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and are a hard working, self-motivated individual.
A skilled prioritizer

elements.title: About the job
elements.text: As a Production Engineer at Volta Greentech you will be a core team member in Volta Greentechâ€™s manufacturing team. That means you will be designing and building up large-scale factories to enable the production of Volta Seafeed that will transform the food industry. We are a tightly knit team, and youâ€™ll work together with our founders, business team and R&D team in developing all manufacturing aspects.

elements.title: Responsibilities
elements.text: Volta is a new company, in a fast-changing environment. The company will evolve, and your role, responsibilities and deliverables will change with it.

content: Work closely with R&D and Engineering team on development of Volta Greentechâ€™s production blueprint to ensure excellent production results optimized for low-cost, high output production
Design, build and improve Volta Greentechâ€™s production blueprint including systems for upstream treatment of water, bioreactors for cultivation, downstream processing and automation of production
Be heavily involved in the designing, engineering and buildup of Volta Greentechs pilot factory in Lysekil, Sweden and future factories
Lead / assist in recruitment of key team members

elements.title: Key skills
content: Degree in mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, computer science or similar
Purpose driven and experience of working in a startup
Experience of taking manufacturing from prototype stage to large scale production
A working knowledge of a wide range of food and bio manufacturing processes
Track record of having excelled at designing and building up high performing production lines

elements.title: Your (presumed) background
content: Relevant education and work experience
Led and executed successful projects with many stakeholders
A minimum 3 years of work experience in a fast-paced environment
5+ years of experience, including leadership, from complex sales and project management, preferably from the food and/or agriculture industry

elements.title: Extra credits if you
content: Have experience of working with FMCG
Have previously worked with OKRâ€™s or similar

content: A chance to work on one of the worldâ€™s biggest, yet unresolved climate challenges
A chance to be surrounded daily by a team of industry experts, as well as brand-name clients and partners
A competitive salary package, with a stock option plan
